alert.note: Alert for Northeast Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 09 at 11:28PM PST until January 12 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph above 4500 feet. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 7 and 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Peola, Anatone, Cloverland Road, and Mountain Road. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Wednesday night through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact travel through Wednesday. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
